title.narrative: Sri Lanka: Emergency Northern Recovery Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to support Government of Sri Lanka#s efforts to rapidly resettle the IDPs in the Northern Province by creating an enabling environment#. It will be achieved through: (A) Emergency Assistance to IDPs; (B) a Work-fare Program; (C) Rehabilitation and Reconstruction of Essential Public and Economic Infrastructure; and (D) Project Management Support.

condition.narrative: Establish, and thereafter maintain, for the duration of the Project, District Planning and Coordination Committees in each of theparticipating districts.
Establish, and thereafter maintain, for the duration of the Project, District Project Implementaion Cells in each of theparticipating districts.
Establish, and thereafter maintain, for the duration of the Project, a National Steering Committee
Establish, and thereafter maintain, for the duration of the Project, a unit (the Project Management Unit)

comment.narrative: 1,200 Km rural roads badly damaged
717 Km roads have been completed.
718 Km rural roads completed.

title.narrative: Jungle growth of farmlands cleared and made ready for cultivation

comment.narrative: 19,000 Ha of farm lands that belong to IDPs cannot be farmed due to thickvegetative growth
7,106 ha farm cleared and 385.3 km defense bunds removed for people’s use.

title.narrative: Jungle growth of farmlands cleared and made ready for cultivation

comment.narrative: 19,000 Ha of farm lands that belong to IDPs cannot be farmed due to thickvegetative growth
7,106 ha farm cleared and 385.3 km defense bunds removed for people’s use. This sub component is successfully completed
6,965 ha farm cleared and 369 km defense bunds removed for people’s use.

title.narrative: Farmlands brought back to production (as a result of jungle clearing, seed provisions, and irrigation rehabilitation):

comment.narrative: 53,000 Ha of paddy lands had not been cultivated (abandoned) due to non-availability of irrigation facilities
107 schemes totaling 19,071 Ha have been irrigated.
107 Irrigation schemes totaling 19,511 Ha completed.
A large number of public buildings are destroyed or severely damaged
472 have been rehabilitated.
466 buildings have been rehabilitation. This includes MPCs, Fertilizer / Paddy, Schools, Health buildings, Agrarian & OtherGovernment buildings.

title.narrative: Returning people provided with access to safe drinking water supply

comment.narrative: Approximately about 80,000 IDPs lack safe and regular water supplies as most water supply schemes in the North are damaged andnon-functional
All 9 WSSs have been completed and 605 connections have been provided against 1,200 applications. 630 connections will berealized.51,226 people will be benefited by 2020.
All 9 WSSs have been handed over for the use 605 connections have been provided against 1,200 applications

title.narrative: Regular CSIAs completed quarterly in project year 1 and 2and lessons incorporated

comment.narrative: It was felt that Comprehensive social assessments are needed to evaluate quality of return and impact of the project
SIA was completed in Jan 31, 2014
The SIA has been completed.

title.narrative: Retunees are provided with at least 50 days of employment in their villages immediately soon after the return

comment.narrative: No employment opportunities for IDPs in the first 50- 60 days after return
About 2,150,098 person days of labor created, 44,612 families in 283 GNDs benefitted and received cash grants worth of Rs 1184million.

On June 2009, nearly 279,000 IDPs were housed in government camps pending return and resettlement in their villages of origin. Theproject expects to reach 100,000 people after their return to help reestablish their livelihoods.
The Government has resettled 585,458 people in entire Northern Province at present.

The Government has resettled a total of 476,013 people in 284 Grama Niladhari divisions. These include 140,000 IDPs who lived inGovernment's welfare camps in Vavuniya at the time of project approval in December 2009. The target has therefore been achievedand in fact exceeded. The project has benefited not only the IDPs who came from the camps but other IDPs returned too.

title.narrative: Farmers/ fishermen receiving seeds orImplements for first time after return.

comment.narrative: Returnees do not have seeds/implements or cash to purchase seeds and implements
This component is successfully completed.
9,603 households received seeds for first cultivation after return. 72,010 coconut seedlings were distributed from a nurseryrehabilitated under the project.

title.narrative: Farmers/ fishermen receiving seeds orImplements for first time after return.

comment.narrative: Returnees do not have seeds/implements or cash to purchase seeds and implements
9,603 households received seeds for first cultivation after return. 72,010 coconut seedlings were distributed from a nurseryrehabilitated under the project.
9,603 households received seeds for first cultivation after return. 72,010 coconut seedlings were distributed from a nurseryrehabilitated under the project.

title.narrative: Employment generated for the IDP households

comment.narrative: Zero emplyment opportunities to the IDP households in the villages soon after the return
Adequate employment opportunities for the IDP households soon after their return from the camps to villages of origin.
